verses.kjv: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:
verses.ct: Shout with joy to God, everyone on earth!

verses.kjv: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.
verses.ct: Sing about the glory of his name — make your praise magnificent!

verses.kjv: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
verses.ct: Tell God, 'Your deeds are awe-inspiring! Your power is so great that your enemies cower before you.'

verses.kjv: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
verses.ct: The whole earth will worship you and sing to you; they will sing praises to your name. Selah.

verses.kjv: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.
verses.ct: Come and witness what God has done — his actions toward humanity are awesome and powerful.

verses.kjv: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
verses.ct: He turned the sea into dry ground, and the people crossed through the river on foot. Right there, we celebrated because of him!

verses.kjv: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
verses.ct: He rules with his power forever; his eyes watch over the nations. Those who rebel should not think too highly of themselves. Selah.

verses.kjv: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:
verses.ct: Praise our God, all you peoples! Let the sound of his praise ring out!

verses.kjv: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
verses.ct: He keeps our souls alive and does not let our feet slip.

verses.kjv: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
verses.ct: For you, God, have tested us; you have refined us the way silver is refined.

verses.kjv: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.
verses.ct: You led us into a trap; you placed heavy burdens on our backs.

verses.kjv: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
verses.ct: You let people trample over us; we passed through fire and through flood — but you brought us out to a place of abundance.

verses.kjv: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
verses.ct: I will enter your house with burnt offerings; I will fulfill the vows I made to you,

verses.kjv: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
verses.ct: the promises my lips spoke and my mouth declared when I was in distress.

verses.kjv: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
verses.ct: I will sacrifice fattened animals as burnt offerings to you, along with the smoke of rams; I will present bulls and goats. Selah.

verses.kjv: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
verses.ct: Come and listen, all of you who are devoted to God, and I will tell you what he has done for my soul.

verses.kjv: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
verses.ct: I called out to him with my voice, and praise for him was on my tongue.

verses.kjv: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:
verses.ct: If I had held on to sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened to me.

verses.kjv: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
verses.ct: But truly, God has heard me; he has paid attention to my prayer.

verses.kjv: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
verses.ct: Praise God, who has not rejected my prayer or withheld his mercy from me.
